atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `variants` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which "bucket" a set of custom styles belong to.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the @config directive to specify which config file Tailwind should use when compiling that CSS file.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the @theme directive to insert the value of a theme configuration key into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The @screen directive allows you to create media queries that reference your breakpoints by name instead of duplicating their values in your own CSS.
